title: Team Page Header
custom_preconds: Given a user have selected a Team Page
custom_steps: When a Team Page is loaded
custom_expected:
Then a team word mark will display in the top middle
and a persistent MLB.TV button will display on the upper left
and the Gameday Audio will display on the right
and you are able to switch teams using the drop-down arrow next to the team word mark
and the team color branding will be applied to the page
(CHECK FOR ALL TEAMS)

title: Buttons reflect Team's color
custom_preconds: Given the user is on a Team page
custom_steps: When the user views the team page links and data
custom_expected:
Then the colors should match the one set for the team page

REPEAT FOR ALL TEAMS

title: Watermark
custom_preconds: Given a user is on a Team Page
custom_steps: When a user swipes to the bottom of the Team Page
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the MiLB.com logo watermark

Check all of the teams

For Future:
User will see appropriate team logo watermark

title: iPad Date Bar
custom_preconds:
https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/IAB-8942

"Featured" game - The featured game is what the Team page's Game Detail section will open by default to.  This should be the current day's game (after 10 AM flip) or the next game for that team.

http://content.mlb.com/search/atbat/en/ios/phone/bal.json

custom_steps_separated.content: When the Team Page initially loads
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the "featured" game will be displayed on the second date of the 4 dates on the date bar
And the 5th block will contain the Team's full Schedule

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user views the date bar on the iPad
custom_steps_separated.expected:
EDIT

Then the user will be see 5 dates on the date bar
And the "featured" game will be displayed on the second date of the 5 dates on the date bar
And the 6th block will contain the Team's full Schedule

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the current date is on or before the beginning of the season (or date range)
And the user opens the Team page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the "featured" game will be the first game of the season
And will be displayed in the first block of the date bar

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the current date is on or after the end of the season (or date range)
And the user opens the Team page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the "featured" game will be the last game of the season
And will be displayed as the fifth block of the date bar

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the Schedule block on the date bar
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user is taken to the Team's Schedule view (Calendar)

custom_steps_separated.content: When we swipe the Game Details section to the left/right
custom_steps_separated.expected:
EDIT

Then the date bar will scroll to the left/right
And highlight the game displaying below in the Game Details section

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user views the date bar
And the local, current time is before 10 AM
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the previous day's game will be located on the third date of the 5 dates on the date bar
And will be selected by default

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user views the date bar
And the local, current time is after 10 AM
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then today's (or the next game) will be located on the third date of the 5 dates on the date bar
And will be selected by default

custom_steps_separated.content:
When you look at the date bar
And there is no game scheduled for a date
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the date with no game scheduled will be skipped on the date bar

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks at the date bar
And the team has an Away game present
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Away game will display the opponent as "@OAK" (for example)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks at the date bar
And the team has an Home game present
custom_steps_separated.expected:
EDIT

Then the Home game will display the opponent as "OAK" (for example)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks at the date bar
And there is a Scheduled game present
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Scheduled game will display the day, date, Opponent, and start time

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks at the date bar
And there is a game in progress present
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the game in progress will display day, date, Opponent, and "LIVE"

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks at the date bar
And there is a game in a Final state
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the completed game in progress will display day, date, Opponent, and the final score

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks at the date bar
And there is a Postponed game present
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Postponed game will display day, date, Opponent, and "PPD"

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks at the date bar
And there is a Suspended game present
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Suspended game will display day, date, Opponent, and "SUSP"

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks at the date bar
And there is a Suspended-Resumed game displayed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
The Resumed Game will be displayed in the cell for the date that the game is being played on
And when the user navigates to that cell, the date for the game will remain as the date the Resumed Game is scheduled to be played on
And it will NOT be displayed on the date that the original Suspended Game was played on

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks at the date bar
And there is a Doubleheader present
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then both games will get it's own block
And the game's will be in the correct order based on start time

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks at the date bar
And there is a Doubleheader present
And the first game has been completed
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the second game will become the "featured" game

custom_steps_separated.content:
When hideSchedule: is set to 0 in the team page json

(You can download the above json file and map to a local copy or QA Homebase)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the Date Bar and Game Details module

custom_steps_separated.content:
When hideSchedule: is set to 1 in the team page json

(You can download the above json file and map to a local copy or QA Homebase)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will not see the Date Bar and Game Details module

title: iPad Date Bar
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed on an iPad
custom_steps: When a user is viewing the team page

custom_steps_separated.content: when a user is viewing the schedule date bar
custom_steps_separated.expected:
the date bar should blend into the header
and display white font over the team color

Check all Teams

custom_steps_separated.content: when a user is viewing the schedule date bar
custom_steps_separated.expected: the format should be Day of the Week Month Date (Monday Apr 19)

custom_steps_separated.content: when a user is viewing the date bar
custom_steps_separated.expected:
the format should be bold for the featured game
and regular font with 50% opacity for the other dates

custom_steps_separated.content: when a user is viewing the date bar and swipes the date bar
custom_steps_separated.expected: should show two past games, feature game and two future games

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user views the date bar
And the current time is before 10 AM
custom_steps_separated.expected: should Default to Yesterday's game before flip time

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user views the date bar
And the current time is after 10 AM
custom_steps_separated.expected: should Default to Today's Game if it is after flip time and there is a game

custom_steps_separated.content:
when the user views the date bar
and the current time is after 10 AM
and it's an off day for that team
custom_steps_separated.expected: should Default to Next Game if it is an off day

custom_steps_separated.content:
When hideSchedule: is set to 0 in the team page json

(You can download the above json file and map to a local copy or QA Homebase)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the Date Bar and Game Details module

custom_steps_separated.content:
When hideSchedule: is set to 1 in the team page json

(You can download the above json file and map to a local copy or QA Homebase)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will not see the Date Bar and Game Details module

title: Preview w/ TBD Probables
custom_preconds: Given a user is on a Team Page

the user will see
Start time (10:05 PM ET)
Away team logo, name, records over Home team logo, name record
Away team tricode TBD over Home team tricode, TBD
Links for Preview and Tickets (if in the data)

custom_steps_separated.content: on iPad (post flip)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
the user will see 
Away team logo, record, TBD, default headshot to the left
Home team logo, record, TBD, default headshot to the right
Away team @ Home team
Start Time (10:05 PM ET) and Venue
Links for Preview and Tickets (if in the data)

custom_steps_separated.content: on iPhone
custom_steps_separated.expected:
the user will see
Time (6:05 PM ET)
Away Team logo, name, record, TBD over Home team logo, name, record, TBD
Venue Name, Venue Location

Home team logo, name, record, Pitcher, Record, ERA

title: Live - Warmup
custom_preconds: Given a user is on a Team Page
custom_steps:
When a user is viewing a game 
and the game is in Warmup

custom_steps_separated.content: on iPad

Warmup state 
Linescore with Away team over Home team
No inning indicator and no data for the innings
0 for RHE for both teams
Empty bases and 0-0 count and 0 outs

Gameday buttons

the user will see
Warmup state 
Linescore with Away team over Home team
No inning indicator and no data for the innings
0 for RHE for both teams
Empty basepads and 0-0 count and 0 outs
Pitching and Batter data
Gameday buttons

title: Hide Scores
custom_preconds: Given a user is on the Team Page
custom_steps: When a user has Hide Scores turned on

custom_steps_separated.content: viewing a game in preview on an iPad
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will see
Start Time
Away team to the left and Home team to the right
Venue Name and Venue Location

custom_steps_separated.content: viewing a game in preview on an iPhone
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will see
Start Time
Away team over Home team
Venue Name and Venue Location

custom_steps_separated.content: viewing a game in progress on an iPad
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will see
Inning number
Away Team over Home Team
Blank Line Score (just RHE headers)
Blank Pitching and At Bat data
and no score or pitcher/batting data

custom_steps_separated.content: viewing a game in progress on an iPhone
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will see
Inning number
and Away team over Home team
and Venue Name and Venue Location
and no score or no pitcher/batting data

custom_steps_separated.content: viewing a game in final on an iPad
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will see
Final
and Away team over Home team
blank line score (just RHE errors)
and no score or no winning/losing pitcher data

custom_steps_separated.content: viewing a game in final on an iPhone
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will see
Final
and Away team over Home team
and Venue Name and Venue Location
and no score or no winning/losing pitcher data

title: Team Schedule - Calendar
custom_preconds: User is on a Team Page view in MiLB First Pitch

custom_steps_separated.content: When you tap on the Schedule
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Team Schedule view is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: Review the colors of the calendar days
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the colors for home games are correctly using the selected team's primary color. The colors for away games are white.

custom_steps_separated.content: When you attempt to scroll backwards on the Calendar and attempt to scroll forwards on the Calendar
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Calendar correctly honors the season boundaries that have been set (firstAllowedDay and lastAllowedDay)

custom_steps_separated.content: When you view the bottom of the Calendar view
custom_steps_separated.expected:
You will see a Home and Away Key

Home - team's primary color
Away - white color

custom_steps_separated.content:
INVALID
When you tap on Calendar and/or List
And you navigate to a different Team Page Schedule
custom_steps_separated.expected:
INVALID
Then the 'Schedule' view that opens will open to the last view selected on the previous Team Schedule Page

custom_steps_separated.content: Review the calendar cells
custom_steps_separated.expected: Games not in a final state will NOT contain 'W' or 'L' in the cells

custom_steps_separated.content: Review the times in the calendar cells with 24-hour enabled
custom_steps_separated.expected: Game times displayed in 24-hour format fit in the cells

custom_steps_separated.content: When you tap on a calendar date cell with no game scheduled
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then nothing happens. Repeat this step for both earlier and later calendar months.

custom_steps_separated.content: When you tap on a calendar date cell with a game scheduled
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then before any preview, in progress or wrap is displayed - a spinner is animated on the selected date cell. Repeat this step for both earlier and later calendar months.

custom_steps_separated.content: When you tap on a game that has not been started
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see a preview Screen for that particular game

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game is placed into a postponement state

https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/mobile/2013+Game+States
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the calendar cell for that game is reflected correctly

Repeat this step for Postponed, Canceled, Forfeit and Suspended game types

custom_steps_separated.content: When a split squad game is on the calendar
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a SS graphic should appear in the top right corner of that particular calendar date cell which has a split squad game

custom_steps_separated.content: When user taps on a split squad day calendar cell
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then an action sheet will be displayed showing the two games on that date

custom_steps_separated.content: When user taps on a split squad day calendar cell of games that have not been played yet
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then an action sheet will be displayed showing the starting time for each game

custom_steps_separated.content: When user taps on a split squad day calendar cell of games that are finalized
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then an action sheet will be displayed showing both games in a finalized state

custom_steps_separated.content: When user taps on a game from the split squad action sheet
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be brought to the appropriate game

custom_steps_separated.content: When user cancels the action sheet for a split squad game
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the action sheet will be dismissed and the user can continue interacting with the team schedule calendar

custom_steps_separated.content: When you tap on a Gameday link for a game that is in progress or final as a full MiLB First Pitch user
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then Gameday will open to the selected game

custom_steps_separated.content:
INVALID
When you tap on the top right corner icon
custom_steps_separated.expected:
INVALID

custom_steps_separated.expected: Then message appears to Subscribe

custom_steps_separated.content: When you Subscribe
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then message appears to view events

custom_steps_separated.expected: Then you will be returned to the appropriate Team Page

title: Team Video Media Wall
custom_preconds: http://mlb.mlb.com/v1/team/atbat/en/ios/phone/bal.json

custom_steps_separated.content: When the Videos module of the Team page loads

Then the user will see a 5 card carousel with the following:
*video thumbnail with a play button in the upper left
*title
*Video Duration (MM:SS) and Date

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user views the video duration and the video is only in seconds (00:29)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the two leading zeros  for the minutes

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user vides the video duration and the video is a single digit minute
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will not see the leading zero in front of the minute

(Show 1:34 and not 01:34)

custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user is able to successfully swipe over to the beginning/end of the video list (5 videos)

custom_steps_separated.expected:

And the video will play successfully
And the video that plays will match up correctly to the thumbnail and title that was tapped.

custom_steps_separated.content: When one video is finishes playing
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then Auto-Playback view appears with the following:
X in the upper left to dismiss Auto-Playback view
'Play again' icon and text to replay the previous video
'Play next video' icon and text to play the next video in the index
'Next video will begin in <time>' text will count down

custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user is taken to the Team's video index

title: Please Read
custom_preconds:
You can test the Team Page by the following way:

1. Local map the Team Page json

2. Make changes to the attributes in QA Homebase:

Ops Documentation - https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/mobile/At+Bat+Team+View+Configuration

QA Homebase Example (ARI) - https://qahb.mlbam.net/prototype/homebase.jsp?#/dashboard\team\ari\mobile-dashboard/dialog\edit\107824726

title: Team Transactions - not valid on MiLB
custom_preconds:
User has At Bat open and navigates to the Team Page


http://pubservicesv2.bamnetworks.com/lookup/json/named.transaction_all.bam?&team_id=111&start_date=20160401&end_date=20160728

custom_steps_separated.content: When user scrolls down below the News, Videos, Ballpark section to the Team Info section
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then user should see a button/link for "Transactions"

custom_steps_separated.content: When user taps on Transactions link
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a list of Transactions (roster moves like signings, promotions/demotions) for that selected team only is displayed. The background tint for the header should also match selected team colors.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user scrolls through the listed transactions
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see that all of the transactions have been arranged in chronological order. Transactions that happened closest to the present date will appear higher in the list.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user looks through the history of team transactions for the supported date range
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should only see transactions that go back as far as 2 years ago

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user checks the header area, to the right of "Transactions"
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see a calendar icon in the top right of the screen

custom_steps_separated.content: When user taps the calendar icon and selects a new date range from the calendar picker
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Transactions list is scrolled to the selected Month, Day and Year. Repeat for a wide variety of date selections including today's date and up to 2 years prior. Repeat for different teams.

custom_steps_separated.content: When user taps on a player name
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the corresponding player card is displayed for that player. Player card is functioning properly for all players included in the transaction (stat tabs are working, stats can be scrolled, card can be dismissed)

custom_steps_separated.content: When user selects a new date range from the calendar picker where the selected team has not completed any transactions
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the text "No Transactions" will appear in the space provided and below the date and transaction closest to the selected date will be displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: When user is on a team homepage where the team has a black tint color
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the player links in the transactions will appear in the team's tertiary color

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is observing the Day of the Week, Date, and Transaction on the Transaction page in different time zones 

ET, CT, MT, MST, PT (also test with 24 Hour)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the transaction is on the correct day of the week and date regardless of time zone

and  tapping on <Year> Schedule and Results opens the native calendar to that year

(the year must be open in the date range for the app config)
